name: Tel chi el telùn
desc:
Tel chi el telùn (which in Milanese means " Eccolo qui il telone ") is a theatrical performance by the comic trio Aldo, Giovanni and Giacomo of 1999, directed by Arturo Brachetti.

The representation, also marketed in DVD version, has seen protagonists in addition to the trio members (Aldo Baglio, Giovanni Storti and Giacomo Poretti) also Marina Massironi, the Italian-American swing band " The Good Fellas " the Fichi d'India , Corrado Guzzanti, Antonio Cornacchione, Paolo Hendel, Raul Cremona and some foreign actors / magicians / acrobats.

The title (in Milanese " eccolo qui il telone ") is a play on words with the phrase " tel chi el terùn " (" eccolo qui il terrone "), which ironizes on the characterization of the characters (the trio it is in fact composed of two northern and one southern actors, and their comedy often relies on their different accents).
